results.title: Farming the forest for woodchip
results.creator_credit: Keith Gow, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: This film concentrates on the process involved in the production of woodchips in the Eden area of New South Wales, from tree-felling to the shipment of chips to Japan. The film stresses that the logged areas will rejuvenate naturally thus allowing continual use of the forest. For a more critical view of woodchipping see “The Vanishing forest”. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.

results.title: No.1 = Number one
results.brief_description: Presented as a visual essay, without commentary, this film concentrates on the physical movements of a top German soccer goal-keeper in a straight time series from an actual game, through training to the big match.

results.title: Tilt
results.creator_credit: Wolf Koenig, National Film Board of Canada and World Bank
results.brief_description: A wryly amusing, surrealistic animation using the analogy of the Earth to a ball in a pinball machine being manipulated by pressures arising from inequitable allocation of resources. Emphasises the urgency of finding suitable solutions to the Earth’s problems, how a little more sharing of wealth by the “have” countries might ease many of the world’s economic ills and presents three alternatives. Script by Don Arioli.

results.title: Dance in the primary school
results.creator_credit: Derek Monk, Freelance Directors and Schools Council
results.brief_description: Shows what can be achieved with children of different ages and varying ability and experience. Illustrates the framework of a lesson; some stimuli used to initiate movement - voice, percussion, pictures; how several teachers, drawing on their own resources enrich the children’s experience; ways to extend children in the main part of the lesson; development of a simple group dance.

results.title: Zoo
results.creator_credit: Gerry Hudson, Ross Campbell and Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre
results.brief_description: This film explores a wide variety of animals on display at the Melbourne Zoo. All the major different animal groups are represented and each animal is shown in a natural environment. Gives a close look to animals we would not normally see at close range.

results.title: Successful staff selection: the employment interview
results.brief_description: An illustration of how the manager prepares for, and handles, an interview to assess a candidate for a particular job. Job specifications, unobtrusive control of the form of the interview, handling stress on the candidate, etc. are related to a full length simulated interview for a job.

results.title: Art, people, feelings
results.creator_credit: Paul Burnford, Paul Burnford Film Productions and Pyramid Films
results.brief_description: The relationship between human emotions and the art created is illustrated by a selection of artistic works which span all periods of history and a variety of subjects. Shows ways in which artists use many materials and methods to translate their personal feelings into visual forms: murals, landscapes, portraits, posters, billboards, abstract paintings, cartoons, pop art, sculpture and motion pictures. Suitable for secondary level years 7-12.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Burnford, Paul Burnford Film Productions and Pyramid Films

results.title: Buffalo: an ecological success story
results.creator_credit: John Walker and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Describes the physical traits of the North American buffalo and its natural habitat, its struggle for survival from the time vast herds ranged across the continent through the mass slaughters of the 1800’s, and the measures taken to save the buffalo from extinction. Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.description: Describes the physical traits of the North American buffalo and its natural habitat, its struggle for survival from the time vast herds ranged across the continent through the mass slaughters of the 1800’s, and the measures taken to save the buffalo from extinction. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Circus nomads
results.creator_credit: Ivan Gaal, David Hughes, Ross Campbell and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: This film aims to portray the circus as a nomadic way of life, to give viewers a deeper insight into aspects of circus life, and to show the circus as a form of theatre where the clown is king.

results.title: Atomic structure and correlations within the Periodic Table
results.creator_credit: David G. Anderson, Andrew Patterson, Jr and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: The first episode of this film looks at atomic structure and the Periodic Table, and the second episoe looks at correlations with the Periodic Table. Using a blackboard size Periodic Table from which individual elements can be removed or placed at will, this film illustrates a method of using the Periodic system to determine the electronic structure of atoms. Suitable for Upper-Secondary students.
